title: (x) "Geography of Thought" (2003) book text face - Berling {Kristian M}
content:
_The Geography of Thought_ by Peter Nisbett, 2003. Can anyone identify the typeface?

Sorry, it’s a scan of a photocopy. (Is this enough? The parentheses and quote marks might be identifying…)

Thanks,

Devadaru

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328212930im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sample%201_5440.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328212930im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sample%202_6350.png)

 [‹ Dépanneur Beau-soir logo blocky compact sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328212930/http:/typophile.com/node/43605 "Go to previous forum topic") [Does anyone know what font is used for msn games? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328212930/http:/typophile.com/node/43601 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Devadaru

comments.content:
It looks like a Garamond to me. Linotype’s Garamond Number 3 and URW’s Garamond come close.

- Lex

I’ll try to upload a better selection this evening. The uppercase T and W are definitely not Garamond.

—D

Yes! Thank you. Well done. What was the vital clue? The parentheses?

—D
Apart from the general feel (proportions & stress) the lowercase roman ’a’ and italic ’g’, and the ’2’ are giveaways. Uppercase T and W are indeed typical as well.
